meanings.definition: The state or quality of being few in number.
meanings.sent1: The classroom's fewnesses made it easier for the teacher to give individual attention to each student.
meanings.sent2: I was surprised by the fewnesses of people at the park on a rainy day.
meanings.sent3: The fewnesses of ingredients in the recipe made it quick and easy to prepare.
meanings.sent4: The fewnesses of stars in the sky that night made each one shine brighter.
meanings.sent5: The fewnesses of books on the shelf made it easy to choose what to read next.

meanings.sent1: The fewnesses of coins in his pocket were not enough to buy a snack.
meanings.sent2: She was disappointed by the fewnesses of flowers in the garden this year.
meanings.sent3: The fewnesses of candies left in the jar tempted him to eat them all at once.
meanings.sent4: The fewnesses of clouds in the sky allowed the sun to shine brightly all day.
meanings.sent5: The fewnesses of colors in the painting created a simple and elegant look.
